reviews.text: Unique hotel in medieval monastery. Room monastic but clean and "spiritual". Hotels dont usually have a minibar - not tjat i need the cohol rather the facility to cool my drimk for next days cycle on the Camino. Staff friendly. No laundry service but a minor issue. Eventually found dry cleaning laundry shop who delivered back to room! Spain apparently not into Laundromats?
reviews.title: Unique
The Most Memorable Stay, A Hidden Gem!
reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers. I've stayed at several former monasteries, but this was nothing like them. One of the kind setting - you just want to immerse yourself, breathe, close your eyes, use your imagination, and you are in medieval Leon. Genuinely kind and attentive staff at the reception and the restaurant - especially I would like to thank the tall male receptionist who helped me with the translation. He answered my questions around and about the hotel, remembered I was going to dine at the restaurant and came up to help me out. It seems like the staff there really work together and happy/proud to be working there. They go out of their ways to make your stay pleasant.
Real Coleglata de San Isodoro is truly a special place. I would come back to Leon just to stay here again!
reviews.title: A great start to my Camino.

reviews.text: We decided to start our Camino from Leon and our first night was at the Casa de Espiritualidad. Whay can we say except that it was beyond all our expectations! The room, service, staff and food were all exceptional.
reviews.title: Wonderful Accommodation, Wonderful Meals, Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: I stayed in the Casa de Espiritualidad for four nights while I was in the process of walking the Camino de Santiago. I had a problem with my foot and was limping badly when I arrived. I was treated with the greatest of kindness by Marissa and Gema the two ladies who run the guesthouse and they even packed me off in a taxi to a hospital for treatment (which worked, thankfully). I needed antibiotics and without me lifting a finger (or foot) the nearest 'farmacia' was summonsed to collect the script and deliver the goods back to my room - amazing - that sort of care attention isn't often found in 5 star hotels.
reviews.title: Civility, grace and calm in old Leon
Vegetarians - beware the restaurant!
reviews.text: We loved the hotel, it is in a perfect location in the town and secure, free parking was a bonus. The staff were professional and friendly. Our room was very comfortable. The manager's tour, as many people have pointed out, was really interesting and Leon is a charming town. However, the menu in the restaurant had nothing for vegetarians. We asked if the chef could make a French omelette for us to share. This was fine and came with a salad of mixed leaves and a small portion of chips. The non-vegetarian 3 course set menu was 16 euros so we were expecting about the same for our meal but we were surprised on checking out next day that we had been charged 30 euros. The most expensive omelette ever!! We left feeling defrauded and disappointed. This spoiled what was otherwise a perfect stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gracious welcome, outstanding reasonable food, comfortable quiet lodging ... and a sense of history right in the center of Laon. A plus was the free tour of the ancient monastery with its history in Spanish and English.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.text: The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Nothing was too much for them. The hotel is very well appointed and positioned for the medival town.We were walking the Camino and a night of luxury was very welcome and lived up to our expectations. The tour of the Convent/Hotel was very informative and well worth the 40 minutes.Thank you to all the staff
reviews.title: A historic building in the centre of old Leon

reviews.title: Quiet wonder in Leon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my wife said, "they didn't try and turn this monastery into a Sheraton Hotel". So with that said, if you are looking for a modern hotel with all the bells and whistles, this isn't the place for you. It was a monastery and retains that simple feel. We enjoyed the result. We found our room to be large and with enough modern comforts, e.g. bathroom and internet access. We loved the quietness of the location. Our room was one of the larger one's facing the inner courtyard. The free parking is a real plus, although finding the hotel in it's "inside the wall" location called for a bit of work. Once parked and situated you will enjoy being car free and able to easily walk to the Cathedral and old town bars/cafes. Breakfast was fine and the service was really good by all staff with whom we interacted. We enjoyed our short 2 night stay in Leon and enjoyed this hotel.
reviews.title: We Liked It

reviews.text: sorry to say that staying here was rather disappointing. great location - with walking accessibility to all major city attractions, but the room standard is very low, and overwhole feeling is depressing.
reviews.title: sharp contrast between location and standart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the location and the history of the building. You can feel how it might have been to be a monk living in the middle ages. When we arrived they gave us a very small room with two very narrow twin beds and one closet the width of a single pair of shoes. Lucky for us, the water backed up onto the floor when we washed our hands, and they changed us into a room looking out over the claustro which was bigger. Even the twin beds were wider. We had asked if we could have a room overlooking the claustro when we got there, and the receptionist had said there wasn't one available, but I guess they had a room after all.
reviews.title: Historically impressive but very short-staffed

reviews.text: We were there five nights, and they never swept the floor even once. The crumbs and dust bunnies on the floor from previous guests that were there when we arrived had grown by the time we left. Dusty tables, dusty bed frames... you got the feeling that the cleaning staff was in a hurry. So don't forget your slippers.
reviews.title: Like staying in a historic convent, only with modern comforts
Rooms rather "monastic" but in a fabulous historic setting
reviews.text: The heating was very good, which was important because it was cold outside, and there is WIFI but you have to ask for the cable in reception. Also the quality of the beds, sheets, blankets and pillows was excellent, and we slept very well. The hot water and water pressure were great, and the bathroom was new. The corredors are all lined with restored antique furniture and paintings that have been donated over the centuries, giving the hotel the feel of a castle. Still, there is no guest lounge or cafeteria where you can just sit and enjoy the surroundings, except in reception, which is not the same.
